title: Transcriptome profiling after different kinds of stress in rodents
description: Stressful experiences elicit a variety of behavioral responses that range from increased alertness and vigilance to effects on cognitive processes. When stressors exceed individual threshold, such responses can lead to maladaptive behaviors manifested as depressive symptoms, anxious states or alterations in learning and memory. The biological response to stress is initiated by glucocorticoids and other stress-hormones that trigger a cascade of events that can ultimately lead to structural and functional alterations in the brain. These changes are mediated by changes at the level of gene expression, through the modulation of genes important for neural functions, such as synaptic plasticity, but also by modulation of epigenetic regulators. We are analyzing published RNA-seq transcriptomes obtained from the brain of mice exposed to different kinds of stress protocols, to generate a database of stress-related differentially expressed genes and to identify factors contributing to vulnerability or resistance to stress. These data will be relevant for identifying novel potential therapeutic targets for debilitating mental disorders such as depression and PTSD.
license: This work is licensed under a https://opensource.org/licenses/GPL-3.0.

meta.value: STRESS_MICE provides an easy access to a comprehensive database designed for storing, displaying and annotating Human Cell Line-specific gene fusion events detected from RNA-seq data.

elements.title: Search by gene symbol
elements.subtitle: Please select a gene of interest in order to display all the associated genetic variants. Results show a table with all expressed transcripts of a gene in all the tissues analyzed.

elements.title: See gene isoforms
elements.subtitle: Please select a gene of interest in order to display all the associated genetic variants. Results show a table with all expressed transcripts of a gene in all the tissues analyzed.

elements.subtitle: Please select a transcript of interest in order to display all the associated genetic variants. Results show a table with all expressed transcripts of a gene in all the tissues analyzed.

data.variable_value: Here follow the information about PARAM1

pages.title: Cell line
pages.subtitle: Statistics and information about this cell line.

elements.title: General information
elements.subtitle: Here you find general information about this specific cell line such as the human malignancy it was originated from and the identity of the viruses predicted to be integrated in its genome. This latter information is predicted by FusionCatcher algorithm.

elements.title: Fusion gene info
elements.subtitle: This word cloud reports the fusion gene couples which are most likely involved within this cell line. The character size is linked to the number of algorithms supporting a particular gene fusion event: the greater it is, the more algorithms agree on that particular prediction.

elements.title: Chromosome info
elements.subtitle: Chromosome-based information about fusion events (each bar reports the number of fusion events for a given chromosome for this cell line)

pages.title: Home
pages.long_description: Stress mice portal is an integrated resource which allows to query a database of XXXXX starting from RNA-seq data.

pages.title: Downloads
pages.long_description: From this panel it is possible to download either the processed data for a specific cell line or the entire set of data by clicking on the 'DOWNLOAD ALL THE DATA (SINGLE TAR.GZ)' button. In particular, FusionCatcher (FC), Ericscript (ES), Tophat-Fusion (TF) and JAFFA (JA) columns represent the final filtered outputs from each software. The 'viruses information' column represents the integrated virus sequences detected by FC algorithm. Moreover, the outputs from Oncofuse are reported when availabe. Otherwise, an 'N/A' symbol represents missing information for Oncofuse for that particular software.
